enhanced_by.reason: Both methods involve converting a jsoup DOM to a W3C DOM, which is a prerequisite for executing XPath queries.
The convert method also prepares a W3C Document from a jsoup Element, which is necessary for setting up the context node for XPath evaluation.
The sourceNodes method can be used to retrieve the original jsoup nodes from the NodeList returned by selectXpath, facilitating further assertions or transformations.
The asString method can serialize the W3C Document or NodeList returned by selectXpath into a string format, useful for string-based assertions or further processing.
